meanings.definition: The act of scraping or cutting away material from a surface.
meanings.sent1: I watched the scarping of the old paint from the wall.
meanings.sent2: The scarping of the wood revealed a smooth surface underneath.
meanings.sent3: The scarping of the butter for the toast was done with precision.
meanings.sent4: Her scarping of the clay created intricate patterns on the pottery.
meanings.sent5: The scarping of the ice sculpture was delicate and precise.

meanings.definition: A steep slope or cliff created by erosion or faulting.
meanings.sent1: The hikers carefully navigated the scarping to reach the summit.
meanings.sent2: The scarping of the mountain made it a challenging climb.
meanings.sent3: The goats seemed to enjoy the scarping as they climbed effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: The scarping of the canyon walls revealed layers of sediment.
meanings.sent5: The scarping of the coastline by the waves was a natural process.
